message: I’ve had enough of waiting for an answer on my policy cancellation. I submitted my request three weeks ago, and I still don’t know what’s going on.
Good afternoon, my name is Sarah. I’m here to assist you. I completely understand how frustrating it can be to wait for an update, and I’ll do my best to resolve this for you.
I don’t need more reassurances. I need action! You should have sorted this by now.
I’m truly sorry for the delay. To help you right away, I’ll need to verify your details. Could you please confirm your full name, policy number, and date of birth?
James Carter, policy number 987654, and my date of birth is March 22, 1978. But honestly, why is this taking so long? You’re supposed to be a professional company!
Thank you for confirming, James. I’ve completed the security check, and I’m pulling up your records now. One moment, please.
I can see that your cancellation request is pending approval from our back-office team. I sincerely apologize that no one has updated you about this sooner.
Pending approval? This is ridiculous! I’ve done my part. Why does this always take so long with you people?
I completely understand your frustration, James. I’ll escalate this to ensure it’s prioritized. You’ll receive an update from our team within 48 hours, and I’ll personally follow up to confirm.
No, this isn’t good enough. I’ve had enough of your excuses. I want to make a formal complaint about this incompetence.

I’m very sorry to hear that, James. I’ll file your complaint right away and ensure it’s reviewed by our complaints team. You’ll receive a confirmation and details about next steps within two business days. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
No, just fix this. I’ll be looking at other insurance companies after this experience.

Understood, James. I’ll make sure your request and complaint are addressed promptly. Thank you for bringing this to our attention, and I deeply regret the inconvenience caused. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you need further assistance.
